snippet: An article in The Lancet suggests that pulling on the umbilical cord, or controlled cord traction, does not significantly reduce blood loss in women and may in fact endanger them.
abstract: Study published in journal The Lancet finds that common midwife practice in Africa and Asia of removing the placenta by pulling on the umbilical cord does not reduce risk of hemorrhage for the mother and carries other unnecessary risks.
lead_paragraph: An article in The Lancet suggests that pulling on the umbilical cord, or controlled cord traction, does not significantly reduce blood loss in women and may in fact endanger them.

headline.seo: Study Says Umbilical Cord Shouldn’t Be Pulled During Labor
headline.main: Childbirth: A Different Way to Remove the Placenta May Save Mothers’ Lives, a Study Finds
headline.print_headline: Childbirth: A Different Way to Remove the Placenta May Save Mothers’ Lives, a Study Finds

keywords.value: Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas
keywords.name: glocations
